p: Recently, Adedeji et al. 123, 124 reported a small 1,2,4-triazole derivative 87 (SSYA10-001, see Fig. 12) that inhibited the viral NTPase/helicase (known as nonstructural protein 13, nsp13) of both SARS-and MERS-CoVs. The antiviral activity of 87 inhibits MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV replication with EC 50 values of 25 μM and 7 μM, respectively, and no significant cytotoxicity was observed up to the concentration of 500 μM. There have been, so far, no helicase inhibitors approved antiviral therapy and thus compound 87 could serve as a potential lead for the development of effective broad-spectrum anti-coronavirus drugs.
